title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: First we did a Phone interview and then we did a panel interview with entire research team all at once. It was not too difficult and everyone was very nice.
Interview Questions: What does double blind mean.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very simple and straight to the point. The manager was nice and welcoming. She answered all of the questions I had about the company. She was a very good manager
Interview Questions: Do you know the order of draw?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Simple and relaxed. Interview wasn’t too long but make sure you are prepared ahead of time and don’t tend to stutter a lot. Mainly ask about past research experience and techniques you’ll prob learn.
Interview Questions: What was you’re undergrad research about

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: It is not hard. The boss connected and did the interview virtually for 1 hour. She asked average questions and HR type questions. She requested the contact information for 3 references.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Statistical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed over the phone for the Leonard Davis Institute of Health Economics. The first five minutes were devoted to past experience as seen as relevant to the position (i.e. experience with electronic medical records, large data sets, and certain coding languages). No questions were asked regarding details of past projects or academic work. The interview immediately went into technical, primarily coding-based questions. These were rapid-fire and approximately 10 questions were asked within the span of 7 minutes. Afterward, the interviewer went into the next steps of the interview process. At no point did the interviewer explain expectations or aspects of the job. She also made a point to mention that this is an entry-level job, despite the obvious tone that they are looking for someone with years of experience.
Interview Questions: -How much (in terms of salary) are you expecting for this position? -Have you worked with EMR (electronic medical record) data in the past? -What is the average size of the data sets you have worked with in the past? -How do you code to remove duplicate observations? -(In SAS), what is the difference between merging using PROC SQL and merging using a DATA step? -How would you code to check for outliers? -What test would be used to determine the association between two categorical variables? -When would a Chi-Squared test be used and when would a Fisher's exact test be used? -What are your career goals?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: 1 hr interview that became friendship. Ended up meeting my interviewer after for a walk. Honestly very strong alumni make it well worth it. I think that Penn is one of the only Universities where people know excatly what you are talking about
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and then just conversational

title: Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Had to do a spark hire interview which was not fun, then ensuing interviews were in person and typical of what you’d expect from a higher Ed interview process. Very standard questions and relaxed environment. Met with several people each for 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: What is something that inspired you about this position?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: It’s common questions and just one round interview with HM. And just simple behavior questions and skill questions. Overall it’s nice. Just like talk with friends. And it’s fine. Take care and relax.
Interview Questions: Why you want to work here

title: Social Worker (MSW) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: They go through your resume and ask questions about the fields/ populations in which you are interested in working—generally, it is not that hard, but it's pretty corporate-like? They also ask questions about what you wrote in essays so remember it.
Interview Questions: There's a gap in my resume, and they asked me about it.

title: Summer Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Heard back very quickly and was easy to get in touch with the hiring team about any questions. Hiring process took only a couple of weeks. Included online application and interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: This was an average interview. I was asked how would I handle workflow, asked to cand asked to complete a sample project. I was told they would reach out in a week and the position would be filled in 1.5 months.
Interview Questions: Give examples of campaign success with internal or externals stakeholders.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview for the March program, I got an offer around the beginning of March (end of February). In the offer, it marked out some prerequisite courses I need to accomplish on my own.
Interview Questions: no interview questions I can provide

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy. Didn't require anything. They needed the help so the process was seamless. Was for a student job which requires very low level of vetting. People are of course great though!
Interview Questions: How many hours to work

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer did not follow up emails and ghosted at the end of the interview when I tried to see an update on my application. However it was a pleasant interview with two other team members.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself please

title: Director, Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: This was a thorough process with many opportunities to meet stakeholders, direct reports, people senior to the position, etc. Generally speaking they moved quickly and were very responsive, although (as is common) sometimes scheduling limitations and different required processes slowed things down (e.g., compensation).
Interview Questions: Why are you looking to leave your current role?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: I received an email from the person I would be directly reporting to as the first round of interview. I didn’t make it past this round but was told there would be a couple more interviews. The interviewer asked me the most standard questions. Overall the interview made me feel like they had a candidate already chosen and needed to interview me (external, minority) to check some boxes.

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Nice working environment with friendly staff and professors. The interview process is mainly asking technical question regarding the Research background. Not much on behavior questions. People with strong publications should be easy to deal with the interview.
Interview Questions: What is your PhD thesis on?

title: Talent Acquisition Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Only had a first round interview with some members of the HR department. They seemed very disinterested in what I had to say, one even hopped off camera to chat to another colleague. We were only 10 minutes into the interview. It didn't really seem like an emergency and then continued to laugh throughout the interview, smirking, maybe laughing at something on their laptop? the Director even asked me do I have recruiting experience? So that made me kind of confused as to why I was even interviewing for the role. Did he not read my résumé? Overall, I thought my experience was negative and the staff were unprofessional. Bit of a red flag anyway that they're staff is open to work on LinkedIn.

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Registered Dietitian Interview

Interview Descriptions: Responsive and personal HR rep and clinical nutrition manager. I was not hired but received a professional, kind let-down. Interview was not as hard as I thought it would be.

title: MEDICAL BILLING Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Process was easy. On boarding team was very helpful . They send you for occupational appt as well as drug screening.  Process took about a month. Very  happy with my decision.

title: Police Officer Interview

title: Medical Scribe Interview

Interview Descriptions: Behavioral questions. They will go over your resume.  Afterwords, they will ask you to take a typing test. The typical typing wpm they look for is at least 60 wpm.

title: CRC II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple and short. Asked about background and future plans. They needed someone with some CR experience. The entire interview process probably took less that 20 minutes and only interview with one person.
Interview Questions: How long have you worked in Clinical Research?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Received an email inviting me to first-round interviews. One-way video interview done via SparkHire; generic open-ended prompts but allowed unlimited retakes.   I received several reminder emails over the course of 2-3 days until I completed the interview.

Frankly, I'm disappointed that UPenn has chosen this method of interviewing as it seems fairly vulnerable to unconscious biases. Also of interest: SparkHire features UPenn as a prominent "case study" on their website. 

The recording/response process would probably be mundane to most people, but as a person with a disability I found it incredibly intimidating and offputting.  Without a back-and-forth conversation with another person, my response/voice/mannerisms came off stilted and awkward even after several retakes.  Future disabled applicants: ask for an accommodation, either to speak with an actual person or to be given the interview questions prior to recording.  I wish I had.

As a final note, I was rejected for a similar position in another department a week after I submitted this interview.  Correlation does not imply causation, but it would not surprise me if one interview is used across several applications.
Interview Questions: How has your experience and background prepared you to be effective in an environment that values inclusion and diversity?

title: Global Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Process took over 3 months. A month after applying, they reached out to have me do a virtual interview (no person, just me and a camera) and then after another month I was asked I do a 4 hour interview, of which I had to take time off of work for. That interview was nice because I got to meet people within the department, but then another 6 weeks past by and I received a rejection. The rejection was nice and personalized, but asking candidates to do that much interviewing was unnecessary and disrespectful to our (unpaid) time
Interview Questions: Many “what would you do in xyz situation” questions

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had six interviews with different people in the organization. People raved about how much they love Penn and it's culture. It was a lengthy process, and I was only notified I was not selected when I reached out and asked what was the status of my interview.
Interview Questions: -How do you see yourself developing this program into other aspects of the University? -What brought you tho this position? -What do you know about the topic matter around this position?

title: Jr. Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Two system administrators interviewed me and asked various questions about my familiarity with Linux, ansible, and computer hardware. They also gave me a sheet of paper with different IT areas and had me mark which ones I was comfortable with and explain them.
Interview Questions: Explain the difference between a CPU and GPU?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were around 3. All short but fair questions with an assessment at the end. The assessment was not an easy one even though they said it was supposed to be done quickly. SALARY was never discussed and here lies why I am posting this as a negative experience. All of UPenn's job postings have a BROAD salary range. This one was $60,000-$130,000. This is extremely misleading as they usually have a set budget but this is never mentioned. Was offered $72,000 which in this market is insulting with someone with proper experience. They then upped it to $76,000 and that was it. Offer was then rescinded. I would HIGHLY recommend for the actual budget to be mentioned in interviews for the next occasions.  They also contacted my references before even giving an offer or mentioning salary. Salary should always be discussed before this at the very least to save people time.
Interview Questions: These all depend on the department but most went in depth to experience and how ones qualifications fit.

title: Statistical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Good job covering the different aspects of the job, what would be expected, and how they could help you further your goals. Met with multiple people and were very engaging about what they do and why they do it
Interview Questions: What would you like to get out of this job

title: Evaluation and reporting coordinator  Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Had multiple rounds all of which I did great but the salary was the deal breaker. They offered very less and no relocation costs. 

The 1 st round was a written questionnaire which was filled online and the next round was with the hiring manager who was also the recruiter. Then had 2 separate 1 hour rounds with a team member and a person from another department I would potentially work with. Everything went great till here.

On a random day the hiring manager just calls me and asks what my salary expectations are and just said they couldn’t do it after hearing me didn’t even negotiate.
Interview Questions: Question related to surveys. Experience with surveys and how you handled the data

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Good interview, unable to shift salary out of range though, regardless of what you can bring to the table so keep that in mind when applying. They have standards for the University as a whole and they say they are unable to adjust them.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this research?

title: Alumni Career Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy first interview, woman was friendly. It didn't take long, and at the end she stated that someone would reach out about an interview with two people following. This didn't happen.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: It was fun to talk to the recruiter, and I felt comfortable to share my academic progress and research. The recruiter came across in a warm and genuine way by sharing her experience and providing feedback.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this major at the first place

title: Medical Writer Interview

title: Research Project Manager Interview

There are three phases 
Fiest step: Application - not too long, easy to navigate
Second step:  Video recording first interview - fairly easy process, not too stressful 
Third step: Virtual panel last interview

title: Grants Manager Interview

Interview Questions: why do you want to work for UPenn

title: Program Coordinator Interview

title: College House Office Assistant Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Coordinator Interview

How would you address a angry customers emails. 

They wanted a type response

title: Environmental Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I was offered a one-way interview at the start of quarantine, so about March/April. It was me recording on video responses to questions about working in EGD, why I was interested in working at UPenn, etc. The questions did require some thought, so thank goodness there were unlimited recordings available. 

A month or so later, I received a phone call from a woman in HR who said she thinks they sent me a rejection email, but didn't mean to and that they actually want to offer me a second interview with the team. I laughed and accepted, so we scheduled and I had my second interview over Zoom. It went quite well, and they were very much interested in my work experience at one of my previous jobs. I was told at the end of the interview that I would hear back in a couple of weeks.

Two months later with one collateral email (they wanted to see more work of mine) and two follow-ups later, I heard nothing back. No acknowledgement to the collateral post-interview, no response to my two follow-ups. I made sure to check my app status often and it was still "in process" up until last night where it said "Candidate not Hired for Position". So I'm bummed I didn't get it, but I'm more upset at the rudeness and unprofessional way they're handling things. I get things are busy with school starting and all of the COVID madness, but to not hear back at ALL? I didn't even get an automated rejection email.
Interview Questions: Describe an EGD project/system you designed

title: SummerCenter for Ethics and the Rule of Law Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions:
I received an invitation to interview a few weeks after submitting the online application. It was simple to schedule the interview, which was with the Executive Director (ED), and the interview itself lasted a brief 20 minutes. The conversation was pleasant, if a bit rushed, and the questions of average difficulty. At the end of it the ED said that I would be a perfect fit and gave me a verbal offer. He asked me to email back within a week if I didn't hear anything regarding a written offer.

One week went by and I emailed, as requested; the ED said he would get back to me "ASAP."

Another week went by and I emailed to follow-up. This time, I received no response.

I then emailed in a bit over a week and, again, received no response.

Two days after this last email I called the administrative assistant who setup the interview originally, not having any other numbers available, and she let me know that, although she didn't have the ED's phone number (they had just moved offices, I was told), she would pass along to him that I called.

Two days after that—a full month after the interview—I called the ED, whose number I located in the online directory.  Our phone conversation lasted less than two minutes and he communicated simply that they would be sending out offer letters by the end of that day. Less than five minutes later I receive an email from another administrative assistant informing me that I was not selected for the position.

Everyone with whom I have shared this saga has found it ironic that the Center for Ethics and the Rule of Law (Center) would drag out the application process in this manner. I would have understood had the ED walked back his offer shortly after the interview or in response to any of the numerous emails I sent to follow-up. But to lead me on—to say that he would get back to me "ASAP" and then fail to respond to follow-up emails—and then to choose to withhold from me, over the phone, that I was no longer in the running, choosing instead to have me find this out over email, a few minutes later, was simply poor form and unprofessional.

I know that the Center does excellent work, admire their faculty and publications, and hope to engage with them at some point in the future. This post, then, is about the hiring process and the poor manner in which the ED managed my specific hiring situation only.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about your work with company XYZ.

Interview Questions: Name one thing you accomplished this year and what was the end result?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Jun 2019
Interview Questions: Merge using  SAS and SQL, difference

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview after being contacted by the P.I through email. The interview lasted about 20-30 minutes. The interview questions were straightforward, and there were not any extremely difficult questions.
Interview Questions: What has been the greatest challenge in your previous job?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Interview offered about one day after I submitted application. Questions were really easy and interview was only about 15 minutes. Everyone was really nice. I applied for a student job in a wharton research position.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position

title: Critical Care Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very welcoming and interactive. Started with an overview of the program and graduated to a shadow experience on the unit, and finished with consecutive 20-minute one-on-one interview sessions with the panel. 10 in total
Interview Questions: Why Penn Med?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: it was two steps one on phone another was on site. I talked with all of members of all group. We discussed about their projects and my project .  It was a great experience.
Interview Questions: explain my ph.d project and present my work

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: The interview was short. I submitted an application online and was asked to come in about a week later. I was interviewed by a graduate student. I later met the professor I would be working with.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in research?

title: Assistant Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application online, was contacted for Skype interview via email. Proceeded to second 'round' of Skype interview which was more of a deep dive with same individuals. Phone call offer.
Interview Questions: How to handle multiple tasks, how to prioritize, project management.

title: Senior Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview first, then in person interview.  Long wait to hear back from them after each.  Even longer wait for an offer letter.  Hiring manager was communicative throughout.  Seems to be a major lag on the  HR end, not the hiring managers/individual departments.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a challenge that you faced in your current position, how you handled it and what you learned from it.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed for a research technician position in the Unit for Experimental Psychiatry. Interviewer showed up late, and no one came to check on me in the waiting room they sent me to. I was offered the job during the interview itself and filled out the necessary paperwork. Upon returning home, I received a voicemail from the interviewer saying that my resume looked like I "hadn't actually graduated from university" (I left the graduation date off, in order to avoid age discrimination).

I received an email the next day stating that the position was no longer available. This is shockingly not my worst experience with Penn.
Interview Questions: The questions were typical of any research tech interview with no surprises that I can remember.

title: Director of Strategic Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: UPenn has a very regimented interview process that makes it difficult for everyone to get to know one another. It begins with a phone interview of specific questions with your prospective manager. The next step is a video interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your management experience.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had a short screening where I recorded video answers to an app. After that, I was invited to an in-person interview with a number of their staff members. Each of the members took turns asking questions.
Interview Questions: How do you see your current skills transferring over to this position?

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phoenix, AZ) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview which went neither good nor bad. Difficult to gauge people over the phone. Would not not recommend. Work study is only for some people. Need more words but don't know what to say.
Interview Questions: What do you do to undwind

title: Ophthalmic Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Met with manager for 30 minute in person interview and typing test. Was then brought back for a second follow up interview with the physician you will be scribing for.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with difficult patients?

title: ADmissions Processor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Received a call for the interview. I met with the Asst Director of Operations and Manager of Operations. They were very welcoming and made the interview very relaxed. After the interview, you had to take some data entry tests.
Interview Questions: What made you apply to Penn

title: Public Affairs Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Before a live interview, applicants are required to do a video on demand interview from their home.  Technology was not easy to use and customer support from the platform was. It helpful.
Interview Questions: How would you promote the hospital’s advancements.

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and one week later, got an email notification to complete a one-way video interview. Three weeks after completing the video interview, I was contacted for an in person interview (meeting with several staff members) which was followed by another round of interviews the following week. All in all, the process took 2 months from application to offer.

Interview questions were standard and conversational. The interviewers were all very kind and knowledgeable. Do your research and ask informed questions when given the opportunity.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you failed.

title: Vet Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Quite easy, and full of information. Very step by step, wasn't misleading about job title. Answered questions thoughtfully. 3 interviews total, over the phone, in hospital with manager and then with immediate coworkers
Interview Questions: Are you willing to train in other areas?

title: Associate Director of Creative Communication Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was brought in to interview with several people from the Penn Fund department, the process took an entire day. Followed up several times, but never heard back from my main contact or received any kind of email/letter with an update on the position.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with fundraising?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward. I applied online and got asked by the PI to come in for a F2F interview. Very relaxed casual setting. Got a tour of the lab and meet the rest of the team.
Interview Questions: Why are you fit for this job. What do you bring to this job.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and heard back within a month. I went in for an interview on the floor about a week after hearing back, and then I was hired about a week after the interview.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you need to work on?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had a video call with multiple faculty members from the department. We discussed researched interests. It was mostly to understand fit within the department. Overall a very smooth experience for me.
Interview Questions: Very general conversation about previous researches and research interests

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: tell about my previous experience and find me a direct advisor on my new job. Then there is a campus visit to show around the place that I will work
Interview Questions: what have you previously done in this field

title: Financial Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I've had in-person interviews twice within the University. I believe nearly all are panel interviews. In one instance an HR rep contacted me directly, in the other it was the actual hiring manager. Both went directly to in-person scheduling, no phone interviews first. The panel asked a lot of behavioral based questions, and STAR -- "Tell me a time..." All the questions seemed applicable for the job/getting a feel for me as a person.  Everyone I ever interacted with was highly courteous and professional, timely, etc. etc. All that said, I think it's really difficult to get in here from the outside, especially if you don't come from higher ed, aren't one of their graduates, and don't know anyone. The last position I appleid for I was overqualified for (don't think this is unusual there), and had probably the best interview of my life. Still didn't get it. 

Also everything.takes.for.ever. and goes through umpteen levels before you hear anything. From initial contact w/ hiring manager until they actually give you the answer took me from 5 weeks to over 2 months.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you failed?

title: Lease Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with one person.  Later received letter from them that began, “Dear        “.  No name.  They left the name off.  Then the letter continued, “Thank you for meeting with us .... we all enjoyed meeting you.  Again, phone interview with one person.  Very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was tedious for an entry level position. I applied online, contacted about 2 weeks later for an in person interview, then called for a 2nd in person interview. Then (bc some staff couldn't attend) was called and asked 3 questions over the phone.
Interview Questions: Standard questions- diverse environment, how well do you work on a team

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Email the professor with your resume attached and the courses you have taken and going to take. Express your interest to work on the project. I received a short coding test in ROS and a literature review.
Interview Questions: A coding test and literature review to test your understanding

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a very simple discussion based on previous experience in the class and motivation in being a TA. The point was to discuss other commitments that semester that would enable me to find the time to TA for this class.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to TA?

title: Lab Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: First submitted my resume and cover letter, then there was an assignment that needed to be completed before the skype interview. Skype interview was about 35 minutes and was offered the job the next day.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in a lab and did you ever manage anyone else?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: About a three hour interview session with a number of individuals that comprise various roles within their office. Short break in-between. Round robin style Q&A session related to my experience. Very upfront process, received org chart to familiarize myself with office.
Interview Questions: What stresses you out and how do you manage stress?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Very, very long.  So many rounds, so little communication.  I had to continuously follow up to check on progress after each round.  It seemed like entirely too many interviews for a job that paid so very little.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: I received two phone interviews after my application, one from HR and one from a director of the program. After that, I got an onsite interview at the University of Pennsylvania.
Interview Questions: They were mostly interested in my research experience according to my resume. They also asked me the statistical methods to use given several specific cases.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Reach out to the department you like, send them your resume and cover letter.  You will probably receive an email if they find your profile interesting. Then they will either phone you or call you on site (depends on your location).
Interview Questions: How well versed are you with Python?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: There is one round of interview with the PI. Location is on campus. The conversation was very relaxed. We chatted for around 15mins. And I Waited for one week and get the offer.
Interview Questions: Basic questions, all based on your resume.

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions:
Interview was discussion of experience. There was really nothing else was
used.  The process started through emails and eventually led to an face to face interview. The process was pretty quick and really wasn't long and dragged out like most interviews.
Interview Questions: What's my experience

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Came in for an interview for a part time assistant role.  Interview was pretty standard, going over everything about the prior experience on my resume and to go into detail about what I did and how I did them. They also tested me about the current position and asked me to repeat what the duties were. They then started asking me questions that were irrelevant to the position and more about the college. They told me about the number of other candidates they interviewed so far. Felt very competitive despite being a position without any major responsibilities.
Interview Questions: Describe the job responsibilities.

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I went for three in person interviews. The first one went well that I was called the same day for a second interview.I went to the second interview and was called the next day for a third interview. I felt really good about the first two interviews but I was not so confident about the third one. Two days after the third interview I went to my application status for the position and it said the position was filled.
Interview Questions: What job has prepared me most for the position?

title: Associate Director of Research Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an assignment to demonstrate my research skills. The next round was a Skype interview. Last round was a fly-in consisting of several interviews. I went into the in-person interviews having already been notified that I was the top candidate.
Interview Questions: What are three words that a past supervisor would use to describe you?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: My interview process is as follows: phone interview, followed by writing examination, then half day in person interview. This took place over about two months, with the position beginning one week after acceptance. The interview itself was pleasant, allowing me to ask questions and meet fellow co-workers.
Interview Questions: What is one thing about yourself that you wish that we knew.

title: Administrative Coordinator In One of the Schools Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: "Interview" was done via SparkHire as a one-way video interview. It was the most awkward, stressful experience. I don't understand why you would replace a phone screen  with watching candidates awkwardly try to not stare at themselves in a web cam and answer *canned* questions (except to possibly get away with letting biases and prejudices influence the hiring decision without coming right out and saying so?)
Interview Questions: Something along the lines of, why do you want this position? SparkHire only seems to offer canned questions.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a 30 minute skype call with the professor. Before that I emailed her my resume and some papers I have written on my research projects, some posters as well.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your research experience, why do you want to work in this specific lab.

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very Standard. Two phone interviews and one on-site. Did a presentation to show all my research projects. Meet group members and just some basic tech talks and daily conversion talk.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between parametric and non-parametric regressions?

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: three phone interviews and one final half day on site interview. First one is general HR interview and the second and third are technical and last is more behavioral. And on site may meet everyone in the office, you will receive final decision in 1-2 weeks.
Interview Questions: What software did you use, what projects, what did you learn in school

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I reached out to the lab PI via email to express my interest in the research. He quickly got back to me and said they were hiring summer research assistants. I had a 30min interview and I gave him a recommendation, but that was it!
Interview Questions: Basic elevator pitch, asked me how I felt the research fit into my interests.

title: Master's Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: uncomfortable--first time doing Skype interview--didn't feel comfortable revealing personal information--like demonstrating my personal passion for my subject matter--over Skype.  30 words yet.  this is annoying.  this should be 30 words by now.
Interview Questions: variety; pretend friendly

title: Tratador De Animais Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied in october, and only received a call scheduling an interview in December. It was a quick and easy interview, just a few question, and I didn't hear anything back until february when  I received an offer from them.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Brought in for preliminary interview for a research assistant position for The Smilow Center after applying through the University of Pennsylvania's own research position finder.  Interviewed with the director of the branch that I was interested in
Interview Questions: Ambitions in the field

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Very standard, one round. Got an email to come in, had a short 15-20 minute interview in which some basic questions were asked.  Manager let me know that she had some more interviews that week and that if I were to receive an offer it would be that next week.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a situation in which you had to pay extreme attention to detail in your last job.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively easy and straight forward. I met with each member of the team individually and with a few administrators the position would collaborate with. The process lasted from 9am to 1pm, so a bit long.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Center Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview,  basic intake a review of resume.  Can't provide more information on the final result as they have outlined a four-week process for hiring and I am only in week one.   They do provide status updates via email.
Interview Questions: experiences with supervision

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen,  in-person full day interview, two video interviews, then silence.  A lot of time and effort for nothing. The hiring manager was very friendly at first, then dropped off my radar altogether. In hindsight s/he was too encouraging early on and made me think I had a chance.
Interview Questions: I can't really think of one question that was unusual. It was pretty rote.

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Learned about this position through a friend at university. Interview was in person with a panel and rather brief. They just asked the standard question and it was friendly, easy, and not stressful at all. You don't need to be dressed business professional, but look neat and use good judgment.
Interview Questions: Q: Why are you interested in Penn Medicine's work?

title: Grants Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: We spent about half an hour on the phone together. This was a pre-interview screening.  Because Penn is so large and its schools and departments function so differently, a lot of the call focused on the interviewer describing the culture of this particular department.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my grant writing experience, team working abilities, and ability to work with legacy systems.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Positive interview process focused on specific experiences and my characteristics. Questions varied depending on my answers, which showed their investment in my experiences rather than a straight forward interview process. Great conversation that was more relaxed than I would've anticipated.
Interview Questions: Why should we consider your application over some of the other candidates?

title: Patient Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: It took a while but I got there in the end - 2 interviews total. Considering how big the organization is, it can take quite a while to get info back, but it is definitely worth it
Interview Questions: Why Penn Medicine

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for the clinical research assistant position for my school's internship program. The whole process took a few weeks. The interview consisted of simple get to know you questions and an explanation of the role. No situational or tricky questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had an interview with the person who would be my direct supervisor. He was very kind and I enjoyed meeting with him. He told me he would follow up early the following week, but did not do so. I found out I had not been offered the position/had not made it to the next round of interviewing through an email from Penn's automated HR software at the end of the week following my interview.
Interview Questions: Explaining experience largely. Very few typical job interview questions.

title: Digital Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: A Skype interview was set up by my recruiter. I met with the Marketing Associate to go over my skills and see if I'd be an appropriate fit for the role. The interview only lasted 15 mins.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with the backend of WordPress or do you recommend hiring a developer?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: The professor selected my resume for my unique undergraduate educational experience which was highly interdisciplinary and  my resume was unique for this job, which the recruiter preferred, I was selected and had a one on one interview with him. The entire interview was a great conversation that lasted for an hour.
Interview Questions: What do you think about lab to market place decision support services?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Interveiw was scheduled after the PI was reffered to me. Spoke to the PI for about three minutes before being awkwardly left with one of her post docs (who happened to be the only other african american person in the room).  A standerd interveiw followed with minimal contact with the PI.  She later posted the job on the hr website and essentially reacted as if we had never met when I emailed her directly.  In resproscept, a pretty negative experience.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about our lab? (I hadn't; they had contacted me).

title: Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Most of the interview questions were general and nothing was too difficult to answer. Receiving an offer required multiple interviews and took a bit over two months from the first interview to receiving an offer. The entire process from applying to starting the job took about four months. Overall, it was a very pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: Describe ability to quickly learn new information/processes/technologies

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy, multiple people, 2 month process, not so difficult questions, not how it seemed.  Employees werent present to interview.  Came back a second time because most people were out on PTO.  More nurses should interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want research?

title: IT Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the position in early March.  After waiting more than a month, I received an automated email informing me that an interview was to be scheduled, and was contacted for a phone screening to occur the following week.  The screening delved into a bit of my experience and some of the tools that I used.  Then, after a two-week waiting period, I was invited back for a second round of interviews to be held in early May.  This interview featured a full hour of reviewing my technical skills followed immediately by about 45 minutes of standard interview operations.

The most annoying thing about this was the length of time that it took for me to get a yes or no.  The final decision was to be communicated two weeks following the second round interview, but it did not arrive until nearly a month later and after weeks of repeatedly reminding the hiring manager, which is unacceptable for a customer service-based department.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your networking experience.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview lasted probably 25 minutes, both people were very nice and asked pretty basic questions about experience and certain situations. Never heard back from them so I assume they pursued other candidates but overall pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: "tell me about a time you made a mistake that affected others and how you fixed it"

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: You apply through PURM and have an interview. PURM is an organization you can find at Penn, there will be 2 or 3 projects you can select to apply to.
Interview Questions: Asks about background information and want to know your interests and skills.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was in a casual manner. Since I've sent all relevant files to the professor, such as CV and previous works, the professor just asked me some details about the projects on the CV. And we also talked about a little bit about my background.
Interview Questions: Illustrate one of your previous projects.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Technical interview about my previous experience and publications. My career goals? There were multiple sessions wherein presented my work and then panel would ask questions based on presentation. They sent me multiple papers and asked for my comments.
Interview Questions: What is my career goal

title: IT Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with the hiring manager. The interviewer was very condescending and left a really poor impression. I was so taken aback by this person's demeanor to the point where I informed them that I was no longer interested in the role. I hope my experience isn't representative of Penn's IT department as a whole, but beware!
Interview Questions: Have you used any portfolio planning tools?

title: IT Project Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and then had four (yes, count 'em) interview "events" -- one by phone and three on campus as well as submission of many work samples. Basically, a torturous process. I think I submitted 8 or 9 work samples and throughout I was told, awkwardly, how many people were applying or still in consideration, and how competitive the process was. Not a great experience, and over-the-top for the level of the role being hired for. After being hired I learned that three people were brought through the entire interview process and even had references called. This isn't atypical for a Penn position, having applied to others, but was a great example of the form.
Interview Questions: How have you managed working with difficult faculty members?

title: Service Desk Coordinator, Technical Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was professional, but also casual. The interviewers asked questions about my Information Technology background, what I would do in several troubleshooting situations, HR questions, and general background questions.
Interview Questions: What is your strongest and weakest attributes?

title: Patient Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty average. They require candidates to complete a self assessment survey and a video montage asking a few interview questions followed by an in-person interview if selected.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Penn Press Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very low-key and great! I really love my job now and they answered lots of questions about company culture at the interview. They also asked about my past experience and what I was looking to get out of a job, which makes me think they were really considering fit as well.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working here?

title: Statistical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Palo Alto, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, one behavioral and one technical. Technical interview was not very hard as the technical work was not intensive. However, behavioral interview included numerous interesting questions and really gave you the impression that they cared about who they chose.
Interview Questions: Tell us something you care deeply about.

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Pitts, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: 3 stages of interviews that were very easy. It was difficult scheduling a time but they are very flexible. The interviewer was nice and pleasant. Eventually, I had a group interview after the first interview.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: I was able to interview virtually for the first portion, answering 5 questions. Next, I was invited to an on-campus interview, one-to-one, with an Assistant Dean. It was very warm, professional, and easy to ascertain UPENN culture.
Interview Questions: Describe my professional experience with employers and developing employment opportunties?

title: Grants Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Two Interviews. One with two Grants Managers and then my final with the Director of Finance. It was very straightforward and moved quickly. I got the position through Penn's preferred temp agency, Unique Advantage. It was temp-to-perm.
Interview Questions: Standard questions (greatest strength/weakness, describe a workplace dispute). Nothing inventive.

title: Technical Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions:
First interview with future boss and his boss
Second interview with future colleagues
Final interview with HR manager
Atmosphere was cordial and engaging
Once convinced about my credential, interviewers were rather friendly
Depth of questions was average, since I was very familiar with the software they used and its maintenance
Interview Questions: Describe my experience with software projects

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen followed by an in-person interview with a five-person committee. Everyone was very nice, although it can be intimidating to be interviewed by a large panel. The in-person interview took about an hour.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my previous experience in higher education.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, asked basic interview questions. My interviewer was from my alma mater, so we hit it off right away. The interview was pretty laid back and got an offer a few days later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Research Specialist A Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Talk about research, expectations, what my background is, go through the motions, have a tour. Overall it was okay but drawn out. Salary was also mentioned during interview. For this position, an entry level position, it shouldnt be too difficult to secure a good interview.
Interview Questions: What experience you have with PCR

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was very simple; this was for a student position. I responded to an online posting on the school website and was called in to interview with the lead researcher. It was a relaxed and casual atmosphere. Many questions were of the "let's get to know you" type, and fairly easy to answer. Just have a good understanding of your resume and what you've done so far.
Interview Questions: How do your studies and skills relate to [research topic]?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Relaxed discussion of roles of job and discussed my experience. A straightforward interview with the laboratory's principal investigator followed by meetings with each of the lab members. If you don't meet with the lab members as a new hire, at least a few of them, I wouldn't recommend accepting the job before doing so.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous research experiences.

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I found my PI through mutual contacts, the interview was pretty easy because I was a well qualified applicant and it didn't seem like he had others interested in the research
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It was short and 30 min interview. Basically I was asked about my previous interests. How did I ended up coming for a phd and why did I changed my track from computer engineering to computational biology. Also the recruiter asked about my current work.
Interview Questions: why I am interested in the institution and the lab?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Submitted Google form and then a 20 min interview. The acceptance rate was about 250 applications, from which about 40 are interviewed. Head TAs lead the interview process. Interview itself is with 2 head TAs- a brain teaser question, explaining of a concept, and then fake office hours.
Interview Questions: Explain static/non-static in computer science.

title: Research Specialist A Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for a spot at the FTD center, a lab in the hospital that studies aging. The interviewer was very unprofessional - arrived late, remembered another upcoming appointment halfway into the interview, and did not give me a chance to ask the questions I had prepared after doing my research on both the position and the lab's work. The interviewer also asked questions that were already answered on my resume, and just overall seemed extremely disorganized and unfit for proper interview behavior. I prepared for this interview, but the lab did not.
Interview Questions: How does this position fit with your career path?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: The man who scheduled the first phone call was actually an analyst himself I think, not a recruiter. Talked about the job, the team, and asked me in general about my skills and interest. No technical questions. One thing I found strange was although the job description emphasized good knowledge about data tools like R, Python, Tableau, the questions he asked me were about Excel. I told him I don't use Excel that much, but certainly if I could get good at R and Python I can get good at Excel. This seemed to satisfy him. Overall it was a pleasant interview, except he told me he'd get back to me within a week and never did.
Interview Questions: What's your favorite function in Excel?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: started with an initial phone interview then moved on to a group interview with everyone in the department that i was looking to work with . Very fast process because they were desperate to fill the position
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Technology Coop Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: The only interview conducted was in person, as is typical with intern positions I've found. The interviewer was very friendly and actually seemed interested in the work I've done and how I answered his questions. Lasted no more than 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: Describe for me the future of 3D printers. (Or something to that effect)

title: PSA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and laid back not your average interview. I came into the interview more tense than what needed. Interviewer was pretty straight to the point. I would definitely recommend others to apply
Interview Questions: Why would I be a great fit for the he position

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Warm, welcoming, and passionate staff. Interview consisted of standard background and experience questions. Interviewers spoke very highly of the institution at large and genuinely seemed to enjoy their current positions. Just had interview, still waiting for outcome.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the future?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions:
The physician reached out to me personally to set up an interview. Immediately I thought that this was either a REALLY good sign or a REALLY bad sign. Turns out it was the latter. The first interview was by phone. It wasn't bad, but he postponed the face-to-face interview twice. 

He postponed the first one-on-one interview the day before (via email). And I only found out that the SECOND interview was postponed the day of. I just so happened to check my email which included a sincere apology from the doctor. However, I was already dressed and in route to the second scheduled interview by the time I received the message. He had sent the email after MIDNIGHT teh day of. Now, I don't know about you, but I try to go to bed early the night before an early morning interview.  So I didn't receive the message until it was too late. I understand that things come up, but that was twice so far that I had to schedule time off of work! 

After a week of of not hearing anything, I decided to reach out to the doctor again to schedule an interview for a THIRD time. Only after I pressed the issue did I actually receive an interview. Finally! During that interview, I met with three different people... in two different departments.... in two different buildings. They seemed sort of disorganized and distracted. But that's why they were looking for help, right? To make matters worse, I never heard anything back from them! Not a "no thank you" or "thanks for applying anyway." Nothing. Nada. 

In hindsight, if this is how they treat their applicants, I can only imagine how they would treat their employees. The lesson here for job applicants? If an interview is postponed multiple times, it's a red flag! Please believe me.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions. Nothing creative or out-of-the box. (i.e. what makes you a good fit for the position? Tell me about yourself.

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a student position. The interview was very easy, as the conductor was simply interested in learning more about my general background. Would recommend this as a starter job as an incoming student with no work history.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Ophthalmic Photographer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Easy going and relaxed. One on one initially then 3 on 1. Overall a very positive experience. The interviewer helped me feel relaxed. I felt very prepared for the questioning.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Simple easy straightforward, they were interested to hear about my research and how i had solved problems that were difficult or non obvious. They look for character and ability as it relates to the position at hand.
Interview Questions: What is a problem you solved in research

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was contacted the same day to schedule an in-person interview. Interviewers were very clear about position and willing to work around current work schedule. Very pleasant experience. Was offered water and fully informed of how the interview was going to go before it started. The whole process took about one hour.
Interview Questions: What past research experience will help with this position?

title: Clinical Research Assistant B Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with the hiring manager who would be my direct supervisor. Started off with a description of the position followed by a series of behavioral questions to understand my background and how I have dealt with situations in the past. Entire process was 60 minutes.
Interview Questions: When was a time you faced a challenging situation in the work place and how did you handle the situation?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Presentation was required and multiple questions regarding your research were asked during the interview. The PI and the post-doc were the interviewers. You have to be prepared to be interrupted during your presentation. In the end of the interview, you will be notified how likely you will actually get the position.
Interview Questions: Please explain mechanism of each step for my synthesis sequence.

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very professional starting with phone screening then team interview. The team was well prepared and had good questions. They were prompt and friendly. They sent excellent directions to the campus, offered coffee and seemed genuinely interested in my experience and skills.
Interview Questions: Explain your 90 day plan

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a 30min skype interview with two supervisors. I was asked mainly about my research experience, technical skills and why I would like to take up the current job.
Interview Questions:
1) Why I would like to work on that topic
2) My coding and technical skills
3) Past experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview started with a tour of the lab facilities. After which I sat down with the person I was to be replacing to see exactly what the job entailed. From here I met the remaining members of the lab and then went to meet the PI. After meeting with the PI I was free to go and was followed up with in the next week.
Interview Questions: Why our lab?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview process. First submitted an application. Got an email asking for references. Then a phone interview . Then a visit to give a seminar and tour the facilities. Met and socialize (breakfast, lunch, dinner) with lab people. Fast and very well organized.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to train here?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very casual and he just explained what he and his lab was doing and asked about my interests and goals. He asked me a few questions about the specific work he was doing.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested? What are your goals>

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: First, I was asked to do a recorded video interview, it wasn't face to face. I had to record answers to 5 questions and was given multiple tries for each. I was then called in for an in person interview with 3 supervisors, given information about potential salary and benefits, and given a tour of the building and office I would be working in. The interview lasted about an hour and I was given time to ask them questions at the end. They liked that I was engaged and interested enough to ask thoughtful questions.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you had a conflict with a coworker and how you solved it

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
