Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with professor over the phone. First to introduce yourself, your time avaliablity and then to discribe what projects you have done before and how are those experience related to their current research. Then meet with HR to discuss with some general questions like working terms and sign up confidentiality agreement.
Interview Questions: What was your experience related to this position?

title: Senior Research Investigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard two-step interview process.  I applied it online and received a response within one week. The first phone interview was scheduled on the following week.  During the phone interview, I spoke with the hiring manager and was asked to explain my prior research experience.  The phone interview only took less than 5 min.  Then, I was asked for a presentation at on-site and met several senior researchers at the following week.  After interviewed, I waited about 2 weeks to receive the employment appointment.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your prior research experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, asked basic experience questions. It was an overall good experience. After the phone interview, I was required to come to the office in person where I answered some behavioral/experience questions in the presence of multiple people
Interview Questions: Talk about past research experience

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Approximately 8 hours long. Met with about 7 different people, including my PI. Gave a 1 hour lecture on my PhD research, and went to lunch with some of the lab. It's a long day, but worth it.
Interview Questions: How will you leverage your knowledge gained throughout the PhD to benefit the lab?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Selection based on class performance. The class involved weekly assignments, especially focused on class presentations. Ability to provide appropriate and useful feedback was crucial to getting the job. The professor reached out at the end of class to see if I was interested. Once I expressed interest, I was asked to write a statement of interest for the role, which was subsequently reviewed.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in being  a TA?

title: Workforce Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: In person & basic interview. There was a group of 3 asking you questions about past experiences and how you would fit in the role with said experience. Was fairly easy just be confident
Interview Questions: what are 3 words that friends and family would use to describe you

title: Research Specialist A Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by another research specialist and met with a few people in the lab that I would be working with if extended an offer. The other researchers were friendly, easy to talk to, and seemed happy about their current positions. Unfortunately I didn't get the job, but I was more disappointed that I was rejected via a "noreply" generic email and not more personally...I would have liked to ask for interview feedback but I feel funny doing so now.
Interview Questions: Name two strengths and two weaknesses.

title: Senior Research/Investigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: You apply through Penn job site, recruiters call you for first round of interview, followed by a second one by the PI, which if you pass, you are invited to visit the lab and most likely give a talk, followed by hiring if everything upto this stage goes well.
Interview Questions: Mostly about your work? Why you are interested for the position? How can you contribute towards the ongoing research project? What is your strength and your weaknesses?

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Went in spoke to the proffesor. He was very calm and collected. We had a normal conversation. He clearly needed me to work to work there quite badly. I didnt mind because the job was quite easy
Interview Questions: Did i have any proior teaching experience

title: Research Specialist B Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Depends on the lab and depends on previous research experiences and what you hope to gain. They like new grads and want to see that you are mature and prepared to learn and get trained. Definitely be prepared to ask questions and show your enthusiasm for the work they expect for you.
Interview Questions: Describe previous research expriences

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant interview with faculty member held in his office. He told me his title and explained his roles.  He also explained the position that I was applying for in more detail.  He asked the questionTell me about yourself, I stated my work experience. He also asked how I handled myself under stress and how I prioritized work under strict deadlines,etc
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself,  Why should we hire you?  Why are you leaving your present job?

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone Screen then chosen to tape a one way video interview (at home) with their preselected interview questions.  Answered five questions and had to tape each response before submitting to the HR department.  I had to follow up a month later as no notification given (phone or email) to update status
Interview Questions: What types of projects did you lead?  Size and scope of project responsibilities and leadership skills

title: RN Resource Team Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Outside recruiter contacted me. Referred to in-house recruiter; interviewed by recruiter. Online survey screening; passed screening. Referred to Director; interviewed with director. Shadowed nurse working in position for 1-8hr shift. Offered position; accepted offer. Drug screening. The whole process took approx. 1-2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Name a difficult family or patient situation and how you dealt with it?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Give an 45 min presentation about my previous research and answer questions from other postdocs. After the presentation we have one-to-one discussion about the ongoing projects in the lab.
Interview Questions: Presentation and technical questions.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied via a recruiter, I was interviewed multiple times by different groups to determine where I fit best in the organization. This process was thorough but a bit tiring for me although I completely understood the motivations at work. After about 2 months of interviews I was made an offer and after some negotiations on the finer points I accepted.
Interview Questions: They mainly asked about my experience and how I handled difficult situations in the workplace.

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: It was cool. Pretty in depth. Went through a pretty traditional research process. Learned about the organization and the Penn culture. Also got to learn about the area I would be work in, who the study team was, some of their goals and how they viewed the position. It was pretty low key, I did have homework to do afterwords which was pretty cool. I nailed it and eventually received the job offer. Not really sure what else to say here, but it was very interesting
Interview Questions: What is your working style?

title: Research Specialist A Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by another staff member in the lab, so I sent the PI a cover letter and resume. I was then invited for an interview, where I met with the PI and the senior research associate for a relatively informal interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job in August.  I received a call for a phone interview 2 months later.  I was contacted for face to face interview 1 week afterwards.   Interviewer was very chatty and often rambled off-topic.
Interview Questions: How do you manage multiple priorities? Tell me about an accomplishment you were proud of?  How do you handle confrontation?  When have you made a mistake and what did you learn from it?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a very long process which included an online application, a phone interview with the hiring manager, and then an in person interview with the team. The interview were thoughtful and fine but there was a lot of time between each interview. Afterward I sent a thank you email and it wasn't until a month later I received the generic "we've moved forward with someone else". I followed up with the hiring manager for feedback and she only responded that they decided to hire a UPenn Alum.
Interview Questions: Very general questions about how I work in a team, my experience with budgets, and staying organized. They seem to be feeling more so for my personality than anything else.

title: At Facilities and Real Estate Division Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume and my cover letter after I saw a job flyer being circulated in emails. I was then asked to attend an interview. The interview was held at the office in the Left Bank Building. The team leader interviewed me with a former intern. Attire was business professional and lasted around twenty to thirty minutes. After a week or so I was told I got the job.
Interview Questions: They asked about my interests and possible project ideas

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward. I met in person with my potential supervisor. We briefly discussed my resume, skillset, and expectations. He told me more about the foci of his research and how I could contribute to his work. I was offered the position at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself (e.g., your skills and education).

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone technical interview at first. You got the chance to meet all the people who are very friendly in the team. You have to answer question including technical and behavior. The staffs are helpful.
Interview Questions: Your most excited project experience

title: Patient Access Representative Excellence Academy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is rather drawn out but I guess it has to run it's course to get the right people for the training class. First, you have to answer 111 ettiquete questions, have a phone interview, and then you must take a few test such as a typing test, writing sample, and questions regarding the internet to test your level of web knowledge. So now I just wait for the next step. The good thing is that my status still reads "considering." I guess that's a good sign!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Penn Medicine?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Sent in resume through site, was called by the hiring Physician, interviewed via phone. Then came in person and interviewed with 2 people including the physician and the lab manager. Was hired a few days later when all the paper work was approved. 
1) Sent resume
2) Phone interview
3) in person interview
4) Email with offer

total time 3 weeks
Interview Questions: What unique thing can you bring to the team?

title: Student Information Center Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: was referred by an employee then was contacted for an in person interview. the in person interview was about 15 minutes, very short and easy. Was asked a few background questions and things related to the position
Interview Questions: Why this position?

title: Bioinformatics Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: An onsite visit followed by phone interview, lots of tech questions. The PI and lab members are very nice and friendly. By the end of the interview, they showed me around their lab. Overall it was very good experience.
Interview Questions: Basic python and javascript questions

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Was contacted via phone and email by HR and asked to take part in a "one-way video interview." They sent a link to software you use to video tape yourself answering 7 questions that you do not get to see in advance. 

2 follow-up emails & 2 months later and still no word. At this point am assuming there's no interest. They could have been courteous enough to respond to follow-up email inquiry but guess they don't have to be courteous since everybody  (and their mother) wants to work there they've no shortage of potential candidates.
Interview Questions: Discuss what kind of projects you&#039;ve worked on and give specifics regarding project team size, budget and duration.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator C Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Old National Post Office, GA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was laid back and casual. One of the most casual interviews I've had. I interviewed with two coordinators first and then a senior coordinator and a research nurse. I also met with the director of the group and a few principal investigators. All were very friendly and kind.
Interview Questions: What do you want your typical day to look like? Tell us about yourself? Are you comfortable working on a team?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with human resource rep, then, with the hiring manager. The human resource person was pretty uninvolved. The hiring manager needed me to meet with her manager, but, that was so brief that I can't really count it.
Interview Questions: Just basic, tell me more about yourself and how do you fit, type questions.

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview. Two women interviewed me. They mainly asked questions regarding what experience I had related to the job, but there were a few questions about my personality. In the end, I didn't get an offer for a second round interview because I hadn't worked with the population they described.
Interview Questions: "How do you typically manage stress?"

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with two people but it was mostly one woman asking the questions. They were very nice and told me all about the job and how it was pretty boring and people only stay for about a year. I was first asked to fill out a short questionnaire and then they asked me normal interview questions.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had to do someone else's job.

title: IT Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Took about 30 minutes. Dress code was not specified but to be on the safe side try not to look too casual. You want to give out a promising outlook right from the start because such a job is highly competitive and is one of the best paying on campus.
Interview Questions: Questions are mostly based on the content of your resume, you will need to back up your

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I was initially brought in to speak with two managers within the HR department and shortly received a phone call to return and speak with others. I asked the woman calling if she would send me an email so I would know with whom I would be speaking as well as confirm the date and time.  They ended up canceling the first appt and rescheduling and neither time did I receive the requested email so I went into the interview blindly.  

When I arrived I was invited into a room where I spoke with three people who had a combined service of 50+ years at Penn. Over the years I've learned that bc recruitment is a very large expense, once you get to the point of bringing someone into the office (especially for a return engagement) you want to give them opportunities to shine. These three interviewers  were extremely aggressive in their questioning, to the point of being intimidating, which I was.    That was partially my fault because I was on cold meds and my head was foggy to begin with.  The interviewers never smiled, made small talk or do anything to "put me at ease."  They seemed to get off on conveying an air of self importance and they looked as if they would rather be having their teeth extracted than sitting in that room at that time. I learned later that there were some internal issues going on so maybe it wasn't the best time to have their attention. One of the three enjoyed hearing himself speak most of all which really limited my ability to provide any feedback, so I was able to contribute maybe 40-45% of the time we had together.  Typically you want an interviewee to speak 80-90%.
Interview Questions: Some behavioral interviewing and resume clarification.

title: Research Specialist A Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by research coordinator to schedule interview, met with PI and other lab members at interview. PI asked about background, goals, any questions about application. Lab members described daily tasks and some projects occurring in the lab. Overall a good thorough interview process at a great academic institution. After interview, was contacted within 2 weeks to discuss offer.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your background.

title: Research Specialist A Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, then in person interview. It's easy if you have previous experience in research. Of course, they explain to you what they do in the lab and what they plan on doing. They also explain why they need another person (me) in the lab and what their expectations are. You then tell them your relevant skills relating to what they've explained. They showed me around the lab. Met current researchers.
Interview Questions: They ask for technical laboratory skills.

title: Human Resources Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Application completed, interview with hiring officer, another associate that I would work closely with and Manger of the Department.  the interview questions were standard for the time but now with BEI (Behavioral Event Interviewing) questions, I would find it more interesting and challenging.  At the time I was hired additional testing was not mandatory for a Coordinator position but now testing is pretty standard (i.e. software testing, writing sample test etc.).  Competition was and remains stiff so presenting yourself as a knowledgeable and competent professional is a must.
Interview Questions: How would I handle someone who was trying to extract confidential information out of me.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied. Just over two weeks later received an email to schedule a phone interview. Very straightforward phone interview lasting about 40 minutes. Spoke with the hiring manager herself who would be my direct manager if hired.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work there in particular, computer skills, predicted challenges

title: Administrative Assistant A Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Once you get chosen for an interview, the process for most of the jobs is pretty fast.  You may meet with a panel or your main boss.  I met with my tri-presidental group, so I had three people on my interview.
Interview Questions: Do you have any kids (my panel was 70+ and all faculty members, and the lone female asked this one)?  This was the worst and dumbest question they asked me.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Great experience!! The group was wonderful and very friendly and introduced to all the lab/group members. Detailed description of the research activities was provided and brief introduction was given of current and proposed studies.
Interview Questions: What brings you here at UPenn?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewing for a summer research assistant job in a small lab in the Department of Surgery. It was a very relaxed interview since it was just a part time research assistant position. The PI asked me about myself and told me about her research. She then asked me what I could contribute to this lab, how many hours I could work, and if I would potentially want to continue the job into the school year. I then met with the lab manager and the current research assistant so they could tell me more about the lab and what to expect.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? What will you contribute to this position? How long would you stay in this position?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Friendly interview that did not take long. Somewhat professional. Clinical Manager seemed nice. Outpatient setting was clean and friendly. Workers seemed like they hate their jobs and it did not seem too great working there. I think that the workers could have been more professional in front of patients.
Interview Questions: What is your strengths?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Began with a simple phone screen followed by brief interview with senior lab staff.  First met with principal investigator, followed by a short interview with a research coordinator and current laboratory staff.
Interview Questions: What is your relevant experience in this area?

title: Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Penn, PA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
1) Email Resume
2) Set up Interview
3) Take Typing Test (You must pass this to continue in the process)
4) Interview with the Head Technicians (2 of them)
5) Interview with potential Physicians.
6) Offer
Interview Questions:
1) If you joined, how long would you plan to stay with us?
2) Have you ever worked with EPIC? How comfortable are you with it?
3) Are you willing to work at all our clinics: Radnor, Scheie, and PCAM?
4) Do you have a doctor in mind that you would like to work with? Why?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Faculties are asking about my work, experiences, publications and skills.
Some faculties asked general issues of my research field as well.
They were very friendly, and respectful. also they really care about their students and staff as well.
Interview Questions: What did you do for your Ph.D?

title: Undergrad Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Essay and then in person interview with the lab members. Applied through a program specifically for undergraduates. Selection process was long but only two steps. I did not think interview was that hard. It was them just wanting to make sure that you were a normal person that was passionate about the research
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be part of this project?

title: Summer RTA for ESAP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online, got a 1v1 interview, talked for a while about managing kids, easy peasy, the interviewer was really nice.  Went into her office, and it really was that straightforward, they didn't ask any technical questions about the TA side of the coin.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a child got seriously hurt?

title: Summer Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process was very laid back because I had already passed a rigorous application process. The interview was essentially just to make sure that I was a good fit for the lab that I was matched with. My mentors explained their research in more detail than what I had seen on the internship's website and asked me about my own scientific interests.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a long interview involving talking to half of the researchers in the lab. I talked briefly to the PI and then moved on to other post-docs and researchers. The process was informal and lasted for about 3 hours.
Interview Questions: About my research in undergrad, about my interests in the lab, and my expectations in next two years.

title: Recreation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Just went over resume and why you think you fit the job well. Was more of an introduction than anything else. Also discussed what the job entailed if I were to be selected.
Interview Questions: When was a time you had to make a decision you knew you had to make even if you did not want too?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: The first round began with a short half hour phone interview with prospective boss.  Then once that level was passed there were multiple rounds of in person interviews with multiple interviews in each round.  Given that i did not know the structure at the time it made it more difficult to figure out which types of questions were best for which interviewers.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a situation where a client was not happy with something and needed a resolution?

title: Bio Statistician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: a simple phone interview. 1) first is about the background information (self introduction, details about work experience) 2) questions about SAS programming skill, like basic structure of proc sql, difference between substr and scan
Interview Questions: structure of proc sql

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Multiple Skype presentations focused on my previous work. Interviews were very detailed w.r.t. to my previous work. Hiring process was smooth. The hiring support team were very responsive and clarified every step beforehand.
Interview Questions: details about my publications.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: All that you have to do is email a professor or go to one of the CURF meetings. Then, the interview was very relaxed. You don't need to dress up when applying for these things -- just head over from class. That said, you might want to wear something other than a t-shirt just for the sake of making a good impression. Be prepared to speak about not just past academic projects, but also things in the private sector.
Interview Questions: How would you begin researching the following topic?

title: Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Not an in-depth with interview and there were some weird questions. Supervisor lacked hiring knowledge and experience. Job responsibilities were not very clearly stated during the interview. It seemed that the supervisor had little idea about what kind of person he was looking for and what kind of skills the incumbent should bring.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this job?

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Sit with professor and talked to him about why I wanted to join his research team. Then we went through the research the team does and what I may be doing then I got a technical question to submit to him later that day.
Interview Questions: Create a graph using ROOT CERN framework to show the probability each that a mother will give birth given that she has reached that day in her pregnancy.

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Answered an ad, they called to schedule an interview. I drove one hour to get there. One person came out to the reception area of the career center and said they would be right with me.  She came back 10 minutes later and said they would be with me in a few minutes. Twenty minutes later she came out and said they would not be conducting the interview. I left.  I'm not sure why I drove an hour to get there and not be interviewed.
Interview Questions: They didn't ask any questions.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions:
Phone screen, then 1 person on-campus interview with the full direct staff.
Questions were as expected -- to get a better sense of me, my work style, accomplishments, what I could bring to the position, and determining fit with the rest of the team. It was nice to be asked questions from future colleagues and to get to meet everyone. I find some times you are more isolated in these interview processes, only meeting the supervisors, in higher ed however, I find that meeting more people is more common.
Interview Questions: I don't remember exactly, unfortunately it was awhile back. Nothing too out-of the blue or unexpected. See above for an overview.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a long process, it took about three hours, but i was able to meet much of the staff. I think that they wanted to make sure that they picked the right person.
Interview Questions: How will you make a difference here at UPenn?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Send an email to professor. He will see your resume and your gpa before contacting you. Once he contacts you, go to his office and meet him at the scheduled time. Dont be late. He will ask multiple questions on your background. Answer them confidently. You will get the job.
Interview Questions: They just asked me questions relevant to the job and if i could answer student questions.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: After applying for this position, I got a email from the PI, and scheduled a meeting date. On that day, I visited UPENN, and presented my work in the group, meeting with my PI personally. Later, I submitted 3 recommendation letters and got a email of acceptance after 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you apply this position

title: Research Specialist A Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position on University of Pennsylvania's career site. I was called to meet the lab manager and PI. I learned about the research projects and toured the lab. I had a phone call with the PI and lab manager to review my skills. The position was offered to me after five months (once the lab obtained its funding) and I accepted.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Bala Cynwyd, PA)
Interview Descriptions:
If you are related to some one you get hired especially  if you have no experience. They give whites with a blank resume professional  level positions while minorities  with great resumes and education are given clerical  positions.
They interview for the process but give position  to management's  family  members regardless of qualifications.
HR doesn't like to be contacted  or asked any questions and take great offense  when contacted.
Interview Questions: is there advancement opportunities

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was required to take the course and get an A. Then I filled out a brief application online. After that I was emailed and asked to schedule a meeting with the professor. He asked me to teach a mock recitation and office hours.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a TA?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview took less than 15 minutes. I was asked about my work experience and then told "there are some things I could use your help with. Go get setup with the business office"
Interview Questions: Work Experience, Topic Interests

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Mock office hour with a professor who taught the class, behavioral questions, past experience, why I loved the class. Very nice guy- was kind of funny to see him pretend to be a student
Interview Questions: Debugging a RGB converter

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions:
The minute I was contacted to schedule my first round of interviews, I started preparing for it. I learned more about the research, and anticipated all kinds of questions. I don't think I've never worked so hard for an interview! So I think this is why I feel it was on the easier side but in reality, if I had not prepared, these interviews would have been extremely difficult. I interviewed with 21 people for this role. Now, in retrospect, meeting with 21 people was definitely a little crazy, BUT they really want to make sure the person selected will be a good fit with their culture, plus will be a fast learner, so again, prepping is imperative if you really want the job....

I received from them lots of reading material before the interviews, which of course I digested and analyzed even in my sleep. They asked me then questions about all of that to gauge my level of understanding.
Interview Questions:
Interviews were more like a conversation in which I was able to present solutions to the problems I had identified while prepping for the interviews. They were very impressed with the accuracy of the issues I had identified, and moreover, that I was already given thought to finding solutions for those with surgical precision.

They also wanted to make sure I was going to fit in with the team, as opposed to come in as a snob director commanding my way in. They are more into team strategies and dislike a hierarchy approach, so there were lots of questions on that regard.

title: IT Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: After completing an online job application, the process first started with a phone interview with another IT Director. In the following in-person interview, it included two parts, including questions from the team that the position would be managing and a second part including other IT Directors and other Senior IT Directors in the department. Finally, it ended with a brief one-on-one with the original phone interviewer.
Interview Questions: Name an example of a situation where you had to deal with conflict within your organization.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Considering the recent funding status. You have to be really well prepared for the interview process. Basically, you have to be vary familiar with your research and the interest of the lab and try to find the research area that is suitable both for you and the lab. You should also know everything in your field.
Interview Questions: What is your research plan here?

title: Senior Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen, followed by two 2-on-1 interviews with members of the department who were at different levels.  Three were in the role that I was applying for, the other was more senior and would be a collaborative partner on the team.  Overall it was very comfortable and felt like a good fit.  Friendly staff who seemed to enjoy working with one another.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in academia?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I e-mailed them a very simple cover letter and resume. They immediately replied within the week through e-mail and then phone. When I went into the office, I was interviewed by two people. We went into a separate room to have the interview. Mostly telling me what the job was about and then asked me very simple, generic questions. I think they were just trying to fill in the position, but typically work-study students are given preference and are used to fill up the slack. They e-mailed me that day and gave me the job.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here? 
What can you contribute?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, followed by reference checks, and all day on-site interview with a group presentation. I met with three collaborators, not including the PI I am working with. Then I met all the members of the groups and also collaborators.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a good candidate for the job

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: the people were very nice. everyone was very helpful and worked around my current work schedule. they answered all of my questions and were willing to accommodate me on when i would be able to start
Interview Questions: what would i want to do after this position

title: SAS Security Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with my direct supervisor. He asked me questions about my resume and my past self-study. We chatted about UPenn and my responsibilities. He also asked to see deliverables I had created, and asked me to explain how I created them. There were also basic questions on security topics.
Interview Questions: What did you use <tool listed on resume> for?

title: Operations Coordinator - Perelman Quadrangle & VPUL Performing Arts Spaces Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I found this position through the online work-study job search, but they offer both work-study and non work-study positions. I picked up a paper application from the Manager's office in Houston Hall. I returned the application to the same office and interviewed 5 days later. The interview was very fast, probably 15 minutes and included a quick scan of my resume, questions about my background and a focus on my interest in the position. I was hired immediately after the interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was fast and seamless because I knew someone within the University who referred me for the position. The hiring manager was transparent and accommodating to my schedule and needs.
Interview Questions: If you could have dinner with three people who would they be?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The process was fairly reasonable for an internship. I applied online and received an email a few days later to schedule a time to come in and interview with the department head and two other coworkers.

When I arrived for the interview it seemed they had thier mind decided based on my resume. The interview was more about the extent of my research knowledge and my availability to work. So if you relax and are personable, more than liley you will be hired.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had a challenge with a coworker and how did you handle that challenge.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Quick 30 min interview followed by tour of lab. The process began by applying online through the student employment page. Sent a quick e-mail with resume and was told to come in for interview.
Interview Questions: Went through the resume, followed by common behavioral questions.

title: Research Specialist A Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: My interview was scheduled directly with the P.I. through email. I interviewed a week after the initial contact, and was given their decision two weeks after the interview date. I interviewed with three different lab personnel. The interview was informal and I wasn't asked too many questions. They did most of the talking and I was asked only about my previous research experience.
Interview Questions: None of the questions were difficult or unexpected

title: Sales Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was short and concise. The manager asked a few questions about customer service and my education background. During the second round of the interview, the supervisor of my manager attended and asked me questions regarding my resume.
Interview Questions: Most questions the manager asked were expected questions.

title: Research Specialist A Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, was contacted by lab PI to interview on-site. Learned the laboratory's research interests and current projects, then was asked about my research experience and motivation. After meeting with current members of the lab, met with PI again to discuss my potential role. An offer was sent a few weeks later.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed here twice- same position in two different departments about 6 months apart. Both experiences were crummy.

Experience #1- Long phone interview, then in-person interview. Travel was (very) partially reimbursed but only after reminding them more than once. They were looking to hire 'in a few months' but still interviewed me. I followed up maybe two months later and was told that they had put the search on hold but would let me know either way. Then I never heard from them again and saw the position reposted a few weeks ago. The people were very nice but I think when applicants spend a significant amount of time and effort going to interviews, we're owed a polite rejection. It's not that hard.

Experience #2- No initial phone interview, instead I was invited for an in-person interview and given very rigid time frames. When I explained that I'd be traveling from out of state (which was clearly listed on my resume) and the times didn't work for me because of travel restrictions, they said they'd get back to me about times in the future because the PI would be traveling. I was able to rearrange my schedule and make one of their times work but wish I hadn't. These people were unnecessarily rude and acted as if I should feel privileged that they even deigned to be in the same room with me. They said they wanted to fill the position ASAP but certainly within the month. Then they introduced me around and just left me standing there with someone in the office for at least 20 minutes… he had to go and track my interviewer back down and then she just told me I was all done. They didn't even acknowledge that I came from out of state on my own dime, last minute, and rearranged my schedule to meet with them.

I never heard from them again (surprise) except when HR sent me an email saying that this position matched my profile and inviting me to apply for it… it was the same position I had just interviewed for a month earlier! And my HR profile was marked as 'interviewed' so it seemed pretty obvious.

It also seemed obvious that no one communicates with one another and they don't know what they want, they just like to 'window shop' candidates. It seems that neither of these positions have been filled.

I'm sure Penn has the cream of the crop to pick from because they are certainly acting as such. But I certainly will not waste my time applying with them in the future. It seems like it'd be a pretty good place to work overall but when you can spot the dysfunction within a one-hour interview, there's more than likely tons more to be seen…
Interview Questions: The questions were general experience questions, nothing crazy.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: An all-day (6 hr) affair at the CNDR consisting of 5 consecutive interviews and tours of the place. There weren't many questions, but rather you were expected to ask the questions. I did some research and reading on recent papers published (there are a lot) and did demonstrate that I had done the work, but still, 6 hrs is a lot of stuff to cover without feeling like a repetitive robot. Overall, I was not successful and kind of feel crappy that I had to go through this just to fail.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience.

title: Phlebotomy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: thw interview was some what long and knowledgeable lot of interesting questions and information I learn about the job and the institution it self .  Over all the i gain mush understanding about the position I had applied for .
Interview Questions: Question were asked about how would I handle patients, because sometimes patients aren't in the best mood when they are ill , and how well am I able to do venipuncture because patient because all patients veins aren't the same .

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: On campus job - one round, casual and comfortable
Interview Questions: General questions, e.g. How would you manage your time?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Basic fit questions followed by technical ones related to professor's research. Professors can sometimes be very probing - but be confident. Some professors might even ask you to work for free for a few months, just to see if you are a good fit into their lab
Interview Questions: What skills do you have that can be used in this project?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Great work culture. Competitive hiring process and wonderful research environment. Love the food carts for lunch around the campus.
Interview Questions: How is that you can work along with your wife in the same department

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone request for interview. Came for job talk. Everyone was friendly. Long day, but not unlike interviewing for graduate school. Asked back for chalk talk, laid out 1-2 NIH grants. Not that many questions, but that may have had a lot to do with the level of preparation. To some extent they have made up their mind before you get there, so it was mine to lose.
Interview Questions: Just preparing for the chalk talk required multiple iterations and time for preparation.

title: Assistant Director of Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I spoke on the phone with my would-be supervisor and an HR coordinator, then came in a few weeks later for individual interviews that lasted almost five hours. I felt at ease throughout the day, until an HR coordinator walked me out and I got absolutely no indication of what to expect next. I heard back several weeks later from my would-be supervisor asking for references, received an offer a few days later, spent a few days waiting on salary negotiations, and then started after a previously planned vacation.
Interview Questions: How do you approach difficult colleagues that you need to work with?

title: Lab Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions:
HR and technical interview with different professors os the department.
Since I was a student, it was easier for me as most of the professors I interviewed with knew me.
Interview Questions: How long will you stay in the job.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Talked over the phone and email. Checked my references. Contract signed at the start of employment
Interview Questions: Understanding that the pay would be minimum wage and completely depended on having sufficient grant funds

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: National search for top experts in field. Generally 100+ highly qualified candidates per posting at faculty level. University is highly focused on recruiting diversity in hiring process.  Would strongly encourage qualified URM candidates to apply as Univ. is really serious about trying to improve diversity.
Interview Questions: How will you pay your self and everyone else that works for you? (little known fact - University does not actually pay people - faculty pay the University a share of grants (33% of total money brought in) as rent.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was in two parts. First was a phone call with one person the second was in person with two people.  The first part was easy the second was a little harder. Remember to be lively soft skills matter as well. This was entry level internship they knew I didn't have previous experience in this feild
Interview Questions: How were my Microsoft suite skills?

title: Registered Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: very detailed phone interview to start.
Interview Questions: What was your greatest accomplishment in life.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: They asked straightforward questions regarding one's background, research experience, previous classes taken.  They provided a nice hotel stay, great receptions with a plethora of food choices, and a friendly ambience.  They wanted to make the applicants feel at home.  They were cordial and excited to recruit new students.
Interview Questions: What previous research experience do  you have?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I sent my resume into a professor whose research I was interested in, I got a request for an interview, and then a response quickly. I was able to start work within a week of sending in my resume.
Interview Questions: Previous projects I had worked on involving PCB design

title: Research Specialist B Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: It took about two weeks for a hiring manager to make initial contact. It consisted of a panel interview. The panel seemed uninterested from the start. I was not offered an opportunity to ask questions about the position. I was practically pushed out of the door and a comment  by the hiring interviewer stating that it would be a very long time before I heard from them because they are going through to motions of HR requirements about paperwork and performing a certain number of interviews needed for documentation (Perhaps they meant the affirmative action paperwork that makes them tally how many minorities they interview per job). Never heard from them again.
Interview Questions: No trick questions, they weren't interested from the start.

title: Communications, Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was incredibly quick for higher education -- less than one month from first call to start date. The process included a screening call, an on-site interview with supervisor and one-on-ones with a few colleagues, a second on-site panel interview and a lunch meeting to discuss expectations.
Interview Questions: Nothing surprising. No "gotcha" moments or hardball tactics.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: It can often take a long time to hear from HR/hiring manager after applying. Very slow process. Every position receives hundreds of applications, and there are often internal candidates. Other institutions will flag internal candidates, but Penn does not. You will often also be expected to meet with many people for interviews lasting a half day or full day of interviews.
Interview Questions: What skill do you feel is most important to success in this role?

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: As with many higher education institutions, the interview process moved fairly slowly. My main contact was always willing and happy to provide me with an update hen I asked, and I was pleased to find everyone I interacted with so pleasant. I had a phone interview, a 2nd phone conference interview with two people and an in-person group interview with five executives. I didn't feel any of their questions were particularly unexpected or unreasonable, though they were insightful and thought-provoking. I was concerned I would feel outnumbered at the in-person interview but each person made an effort to make me feel at ease. I would definitely consider applying to Penn again.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question was regarding the transition to a higher ed environment. I felt I needed the execs to provide me with more information before I could determine what the obstacles might be.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: I was in a different department interviewing for that department in front of a panel of six.  A panelist took my resume back to her department for the position that was  open in her department.  I was call in for my first interview a week or so after the interview with the panel  and the second the week after that.   Was hired and I've been here in the College Advising Office ever since (16 years).  I'd start to interview with other departments after not being able to go any farther in this department.
Interview Questions: The most difficult Question is where do you what to be in five or ten years.

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Give a talk about your thesis work to the lab you wish to join, the group gives you feedback on your work and asks questions. Got to ask questions about the lab and what they do. Got to tour the lab. Figure out if you are a good fit for them and vice versa. Overall a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: very specific to your presentation

title: Information Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process was a very good one.  I made connections and talked with very knowledgeable people.  They were very open and extremely helpful.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the university career portal by searching for the jobs I was interested in. I got an interview call from one of the employers after a week or so. The interview was quite simple, was just asked to go over my resume and justify why I wanted that position.
Interview Questions: Nothing really very difficult

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: This was a rather informal process. I e-mailed many professors who worked in the area of what I was interested in. After that, I met with several professors. This professors was interested in what I was doing and was willing to work with me to help him with his research project. So far, he has been a great mentor. I met with him several other times in order to make sure that our interests aligned.
Interview Questions: Did you find you work fulfilling?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed over the phone. Very easy process and seemed like a good fit. Interviews vary in intensity by department.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application through the electronic system and talked with members of the department. I had one group interview and was offered the job later that day. Overall, it was actually a pretty quick process.
Interview Questions: I was not asked any question that i would describe as difficult to answer. Overall, the interview was very friendly. I did not feel like I was being grilled or pushed until i made a mistake.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I submit my application package via online and the interested PIs contact me by themselves. They offered me an onsite interview. I visited the University of Pennsylvania campus and gave a presentation. After the presentation, I had several meetings with the interested PIs. After the interview, they offered me a job within a month.
Interview Questions: My future plan

title: Digital Marketing Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Over the course of three weeks I met twice with a team within the Provost's office. The interviews were formal, but relaxed in tone and content. Each time, I felt as though I could imagine myself within the department and functioning within a busy office that was essential to student life on campus.
Interview Questions: How would I look to improve the processes currently in place in this position to help streamline the requests of other departments?

title: Research Specialist C Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: the HR will contact by phone interview, then they will help you set up on-site interview. you don't need be dress up very formal. interview process will take at least a day. You will meet a group of lab members, you also need prepare a presentation. They will ask you a lot questions about your previous work. The whole process is very stressful.
Interview Questions: why you choose to work at University of Pennsylvania?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Heavy emphasis on academic track record and prior experience. Must be able to showcase writing and analysis ability. Interview included discussion of results from prior experiences in addition to lab report documentation and analysis technique. There were a few procedural questions regarding Western Blot, ELISA, etc but that is mostly as a check to verify what's on your application.
Interview Questions: What is your prior laboratory experience?

title: IT Senior Project Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 10 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions:
Most communication was via email.  There were two rounds of in person interviews.  The entire process took almost (no joke!) one year from initial application to start date.  
Interviews were pretty laid back and unstructured and included some phone screens, one on one and then a panel or two.  Once interviews were complete it still took over a month for an offer to be pulled together.
Interview Questions: Candidates are quizzed more on technical expertise than management/leadership skills though the latter is more relevant to the position in question.  It's a very good indicator of what the current management values and how the place really runs.

title: Writing Center Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Relatively straightforward questions and very friendly yet professional feel to the interview. Questions were directly related to the job role and also discussed thoughts on the current writing curriculum. Two interviewers who took turns asking questions. Interview lasted about twenty minutes and took place at the work location.
Interview Questions: What is one suggestion you have for improving the writing curriculum?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with two people after i had already worked there. I knew them both but did not previously work for them. Overall I found it was not particularly stressful.
Interview Questions: What skills do you bring here?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: give a presentation of about 45 min and talk to PI and group members, usually takes an entire day.
Interview Questions: that will be different for everyone

title: Research Specialist B Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: They often like to give med students or people that already work for Penn Medicine preference when it comes to final interviews. Therefore, it is helpful to know some one within the department.
Interview Questions: Describe all the steps of (xxxxx) protocol. People don't typically memorize trivial procedures

title: Administrative Assistant - Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly casual and laid back. I worked directly for the person who interviewed and hired me. She was wonderful. I was interviewed in a small room and I do not believe anyone else was present.  I was notified promptly that I had gotten the job.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have that make you a good fit for this role?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Pretty easy
Straightforward
1 on 1 interview with the lab head
very informal
simply seemed like a nice lunch with a friend

Be relaxed, calm, and you'll be fine

Talked to other lab workers-->seemed important in the process
    Be nice, courteous, charming
Interview Questions: How has your experience in research helped you in your life

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: An interview was conducted with the Chair of the department and two full-time faculty members. 45 minutes with varying questions about my own personal research, teaching philosophy, and my intentions and desires for the program.
Interview Questions: What book are you currently reading and why?

title: Physician Ophthalmology Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: I approached them for a special clinician-scientist position, invited me for an interview with several people. I met with all the standard people for the job and I could also select people to meet with them in the first and second interview. All interviews were one to one, no standardized questions.
Interview Questions: No strange questions asked

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process for the laboratory is really dependent on management. My experience was very relaxed, my supervisor made it easy. He was very knowledgable and was the kind of person that cared about the bottom line, not to say he didn't care about the staff, he did.  He just wanted to make sure the work was getting done and done well, any other petty things didn't matter to him.  He was great.
Interview Questions: None really.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: i have just started to apply. Will update when get a call
Interview Questions: how do build 3D graphs in matlab

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online received a call for an interview 3 days later.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied and got called in for an interview. Met with the office manager and another staff member. Interview went well and I was offered the job at the end. The interview was nice and we seemed to hit it off.  I don't know what else to say, but come prepared and ready to show your portfolio.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with instructional design?

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The day was put together in a mostly thoughtful way. although the perception projected was not representative of the actual culture. Most people were friendly, and they were certainly on their very best behavior. We didn't get a sense of what our colleagues would be like.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come to Penn?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
It started as an over the phone screen. If you pass you get in person screen.
I met the whole team, first got interviewed by the manager, then went to a team interview. 
You'll get lobbed a couple of softball cs 101 questions.
Interview Questions: Diagram Fizzbuzz in your preferred language.

title: Equity and Excellence Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
First, I submitted a resume and cover letter online. Met with two team members and discussed my interest in the position and the skills I would bring. We also brainstormed approaches I would use to tackle the main project, which was exciting and made me more committed to their objectives. 

I will add that I was a student at the university at the time and networked significantly before applying. I believe this helped me establish myself as a person who is fun and exciting to work with and talk to.
Interview Questions: Basic questions - strengths, previous experiences, future plans, schedule and work ethic.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward, make sure you posses most of the qualities that they are asking for in a job description. Have the ability to speak about previous work experience, and explain why you would be a good fit for the position you are applying for
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you had a challenging situation, how did you overcome it?

title: Administrative Assistant, Alumni Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I got an email about a month after I'd applied. I met with two women who were super nice and the interview was so casual. They asked a lot about why I wanted the job and a lot about my previous position and what my goals were (they are really interested in people who want to continue their education with UPENN)
Interview Questions: They asked what aspect of my previous job I didn't like the most/wouldn't want to come up in this position. I didn't have a good answer for that.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward, met with project manager than with Principle Investigator. They wanted to know about my experience doing basic research support tasks such as consenting or recruiting patients to a study, regulatory work with IRB and data entry. I did not have to meet with anybody from human resources. There was just one interview, no follow ups. It did take several weeks for me to get my official offer as the HR process was very slow.
