Interview Questions: Give an example of difficult situation you were in with research participants and how you resolved it.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: First it was a phone interview and then face to face with three managers and the head of the department on a separate day. Overall, all the questions and discussion were about the undergoing projects.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Information Technology Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Really short personality based interview. You meet with the managers and they ask you a few questions like "whats your background with working with several operating systems?" or "whats your experience with Lenox computers?" They give you the low down on your responsibilities while on duty as well - (restocking paper, filling out inventory, etc).
Interview Questions: What is our policy regarding students pirating music?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Presentation and met with lab personnel
Interview Questions: Most questions were about research vision

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Typical Postdoc interview.  Was asked by the PI to come the following week.  Spent about 5 hours speaking with graduate students, MD/PhD students and the PI about their research and what the lab was like.  Spoke indiviually with the PI for quite a while about available projects.  Presented my thesis work in a 1 hour seminar.
Interview Questions: The students are very bright and asked very detailed and difficult questions about my thesis work.

title: Information Technology Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
The whole process took about 2 weeks. I applied online through College House Computing's online application, was offered an interview by the manager and assistant manager of the College House to which I applied, and then got my offer a few days later.

The interview process was very formal, but both managers interviewing me were students.
Interview Questions: What would you do in the event of a student coming in with a computer that had significant water damage?

title: Research Specialist A Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via email by the principal investigator (PI). We set up for an interview, which was very casual and laid back. Everyone in the department I interviewed in was helpful, as finding my way to the Principal Investigator's office was a task. When the interview was over, the PI promised to get in touch with me within two weeks. I got the job, and the rest is history.
Interview Questions: There was none. The interview was very easy, thankfully.

title: Development & Alumni Relations Temp Employee Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: There was an opportunity to work as a temporary employee at Penn DAR. My experience in development was limited, but I was brought in and interviewed with the department head as well as his boss. The boss was a very nice guy and didn't throw any curve ball questions at me, just very straight-forward about my interest in the position and what I would offer them as an employee there. Since the boss already liked me, the interview with the department head didn't even last 5 minutes. In fact, we simply talked about the details of how and when I would start. Overall a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: What are your long-term goals

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very organized and professional. The interviewer was very good at describing the nature of the job and, as it turned out, it wasn't really what I was looking for and I don't think I was who they were looking for. Every aspect of the interview process was well-handled.
Interview Questions: Most questions were around fit. I interviewed with two people in the department, both were good interviewers (and people I felt I would like working with.)

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Got one phone interview with one of the junior assistant professor and done. He was just asking about behavior questions, review of my background and status of my other applications. The goal of this interview may mainly to test my speaking in academic environment given I am a international student.
Interview Questions: Tell them about my undergraduate research project.

title: Research Specialist B Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. After following up, I was contacted by the lab manager and came in to interview. I went through very laid back, informal 30 minute  interviews with about 6 different members of the lab. The interviews were all very standard, no behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: ESL Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Two people interviewed me. They had 4 questions. What's your teaching philosophy? Have you had a troublesome student how did you deal with it? Walk me through a recent lesson plan. What courses are you interested in teaching? Are you open to other courses?
I got to ask my questions in the end
Interview Questions: Troublesome student question caught me off guard I guess

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easy.  This was ASIC Design Engineer position
Interview Questions: Asked mainly about my projects

title: Research Specialist A Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I received an email from the office of the PI for whose lab I had applied to. The interview was scheduled entirely through email. The process consisted of a one on one interview with the PI, who had seen my qualifications on my resume and had been curious as to the fact that I went to the same graduate school as the one she'd been teaching at until recently. However, this seemed about as far as her interest went as far as I was concerned.

She said up front without barely asking any questions that the job she had in mind probably wasn't a good fit for me, but reassured me that I should keep looking for a job and if I didn't find one within a few weeks to contact her again for another position that she might need filling in the future.

It was a very odd experience, but one that I came out of fairly happy.
Interview Questions: What sort of experience and techniques do you have in the lab?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Directly contacted a Faculty researcher, who's lab I wanted to join. Phone interview followed by an invitation to present my PhD research and meet the lab. After the meeting an offer was extended to me and I decided within a week. My job began 5-6 months after my interview, after I received my PhD.
Interview Questions: What project I wanted to be on and my ideas for the future experiments and direction of the project within the coming years. How my skills would apply to the project and what I would also gain from the proposed work. How wold this shape/direct my career trajectory.

title: Work Study Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I reached out to the head of the department and found out a time to meet with her. I made sure to do this before the school year started, which helped me get the position. She had vacancies as a result of graduated seniors, so the timing worked out perfectly.
Interview Questions: There were very few difficult questions. I approached her with honesty, and she was very understanding given my position as a student.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Actually, there is no interview. But a test needs to be taken for non-native speakers. You first need to participate in a computer based test. Then if your results meet a certain standard, you are qualified. Otherwise, you need participate in a second stage. You need to give a short teaching sample, with three evaluators as your audience. The teaching sample needs to be related to your field of study.
Interview Questions: A standard test similar to TOFEL speech test.

title: Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Three in-person interviews with development officers, admissions officers,  professors and associate dean of law school.  Note: Interview process may have been easier as I secured the first interview be referral.
Interview Questions: The usual - describe experience, strengths, what can you contribute, etc.

title: CRC Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was hired as a summer intern and then moved into a paid position. First there was a phone interview with the PI and then an in person interview with the PI.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Found job listing on school website, and emailed my interests and resume.  Met for a 1 on 1 interview the next week.  Interview consisted of him telling me about his research.  Asked me about my experience.  Pretty informal as far as interviews go.  Overall was pretty happy with interview, had a great conversation.  However afterwards took a while to get a response, since he was interviewing others as well.
Interview Questions: What is your background in this area?

title: Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very long (spread over 5 months). I had a phone interview, in person interview with the group and with the director and PI. The hiring process was relatively quick. (3 weeks).
Interview Questions: Asked about my background and past expereinces

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very long interview process. Met with 10 people over 2 days. Everyone is very educated. The interviewers are very passionate about their work. It took about 3 months to hear back about my interview. I've heard some people say it took 6 months.
Interview Questions: Be prepared to articulate your strengths and weaknesses.

title: Research Specialist B Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied on-line, phone screen within a few weeks, phone screen with supervisor a week later  and in-person after another week. in-person interview was relaxed and informal. I showed a portfolio of work and discussed the up coming project  funding. They asked to to describe how I would approach the proposed project. Some technical questions about methods and instruments.Then they asked for internal & external references.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation at work where you had to deal with a difficult co-worker.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The whole atmosphere was cordial and relaxed, discussion was research related , most of the questions were related to subject, no tricky questions. Interview was a discussion format where I talked about my personal interests and the future goals. one or two tricky kind of questions but overall a good experience
Interview Questions: suject/research related

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: i was emailed to get a confirmation for the interview. i got a phone call and took the interview. they were not willing to sponsor h1b visa.
Interview Questions: why there is a gap in your resume. will you remember all the techniques?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was very straightforward. Wrote my PI about interest in his group. I heard back in 10 mins that he is interested and immediately setup date for interview. Gave a talk and got job offer in three weeks
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Submit online with gre, as it is a typical graduate school application. I waited for 3 months and received acceptance by email.
I had one phone interview and it was typical interview, just reading my state of purpose documents.
There is visiting weekend to tour the school and see how you can fit, but this is only for who were accepted.
I accepted the offer.
Overall, it was pleasant interview process.
Interview Questions: which research are you interested

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: The first part of the application to be a doctoral student involves essays, letters of recommendation, and transcripts. The letters are crucial and need to be people that can speak to your abilities in an informed way. In February, students are brought to interview and treated to nice dinners and amenities along the way. The school is clearly trying to impress you as much as you are trying to impress it. Most of the weekend involves information sessions, but there are individual interviews with faculty that run more like conversations. It is a really nerve racking experience, but they tell you the whole time, and it's true, that you are already "good enough" by virtue of being interviewed. The interview is meant to evaluate fit- are you interested in the right stuff to be matched up with an advisor that can support you through the process.
Interview Questions: No questions, just chatting.

title: Operations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: They called for an interview and basically told me that I was to qualified for the job but I had it if I wanted it. It wasn't a high paying position nor did I expect it to be, it was just what I was looking for.
Interview Questions: There are not really any that I can think of, to be honest there weren't many questions at all.

title: Bio Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: You will be given a medical dataset with a set of requests that require statistical analysis, data manipulation and then a verbal summary of your logic for each. Each question builds on the previous, so it requires sound statistical programming skills.
Interview Questions: The requests to change the display of the data to summarize the data at the hospital not person level.

title: Research Project Manager B Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by the prinicpal Investigator.  Job duties were discussed in detail.  Human resource manager, COO of the department, all reviewed some details of the position and discussed if this would be of interest to me.  My questions were answered thoroughly by all.  During the interviewing process, I was shown some details of how I would collect the data for the job.  Also during the interview I was informed there would be some additional training needed for this job.
Interview Questions: Was traveling an issue for me?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: interview weekend consisting of meetings with requested professors, weekend activities with current students, overview of university session. Mostly a pitch session to encourage students to accept offers. International applicants, be warned, they usually accept 1-2 international students a year per department.
Interview Questions: Describe your current research

title: Research Specialist A Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: After filling out an online application, I was contacted by an administrative assistant who scheduled my interview. I met with the Principal Investigator first and we went over my work experience, college courses, and what the position would entail. Next, the admin assistant walked me to the lab where I met a few grad students and was shown around the lab. Apparently this is how each candidate was vetted. The grad students had a large say in who was hired and they had access to each candidate's resume.
Interview Questions: I was asked if I had questions that I wanted answered. Since I didn't know anything about the lab or my position until I had the interview, I didn't have anything prepared

title: Project Manager/Researcher/Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview steps consisted of: Applying, Interviewing and Hiring. It also helped that I had worked on the same problem for my PhD dissertation and the projects I was going to work on was an extension of the same capabilities.
Interview Questions: As wide as predictive modeling, programming, sales, project management etc

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview. I was asked a few questions about my relevant coursework in college, and why I wanted to work in a biology lab. They sold the lab just as much as I had to sell myself. I was asked for a couple examples of difficult situations working with others and what I thought my best skills were.
Interview Questions: What previous lab experience do you have? Any independent research?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Poor communication throughout the process.  Little transparency.  Appeared that the interviewer had not read either the cover letter or the resume.  Clear that they were just going through the motions; anecdotes from other applicants indicated they already had a preferred internal candidate and were just going through the motions of looking at other applicants.
Interview Questions: Spent half the time explaining the job to me when it was clear from cover letter I already knew the background

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was then called for interview. then i went to the LAb. It was a day process starting early morning with breakfast interview, then a series of 1-on-1s (about 30/50 minutes each), then a presentation .?Very tiring process, but everyone was very friendly. Approximately a month or so later, they invited me back to spend another day talking to people, but not giving any presentations. The offer came a month or so later.
Interview Questions: What do you want to be in five years?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Chat with supervisor by phone, then in person interview a few weeks later. The interview was pretty standard but casual - my supervisor was wearing a t-shirt and jeans!  Pretty low pressure. I was prepared, having researched my supervisor's work beforehand and asking the appropriate, informed questions, which every academic candidate should be sure to do.

Didn't get a chance to see the office or culture.
Interview Questions: What do you plan to do with your clinical degree/license?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview was well organized and I got to see firsthand what a day would be like within the organization
Interview Questions: Nothing was out of the ordinary

title: Parking Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty basic. Asked me why I wanted to work at UPenn, why I would be good in the position, and all the other basic interview questions. It was only the first of 3 in the interview process. Basically weeding out to get to the next level.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a parking problem on the day of a big event?

title: Administrative Assistant B Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call asking if I would be interested in meeting with the department concerning a position they currently had available.  We arranged for the meeting time.  At the time of the interview I met with the Department Manager and the HR Person. Both ladies were very professional, very nice and easy to talk with regarding the position and the requirements of the position.  The office environment was very neat and clean, and the people I encountered on the way to the interview were very pleasant and helpful.
Interview Questions: The questions asked were not difficult per say, they were expected questions. Generally asking "tell me about yourself"?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: PI gave a talk and met with one of the post doc. Interviewed with post doc.
Interview Questions: Discussed about projects regarding the PI's grant.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: One day interview process. Two people interviewed me and then showed me the lab.
Interview Questions: Protocol questions.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a Data Analyst position on-line and after two months I got an interview. I talked to 5 people in their group in an informal manner. Each session was about 15 minutes. Everyone was nice. No tough technical questions asked. They asked what kind of languages I can program in and what level.
Interview Questions: why Upenn?

title: Senior Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interviews typically consist of a phone screen followed by a half-day or whole day session where the candidate meets with multiple individuals and small groups. There is often a lunch session including previously met staff members and new people. Penn looks for strong technical skills and a good cultural fit.
Interview Questions: I was asked a few questions regarding specific technology products I had zero experience with. I just stated that I don't know anything about those.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and got a response two weeks later. I would recommend applying the day the job is posted to get in the pool of applications that actually get received. There was a scheduled phone interview where I was asked questions like "Describe yourself", "Describe how you handle stress", "What is your experience with MS Office?", very basic, non-behavioral based interview questions. After a successful phone interview, I did a 1:1 interview with the Assistant Dean of the dept., who was nice and asked several of the same questions in the phone interview. Then I was sent to a series of panel interviews that combined lasted about 3 hours. The questions were all focused on my skill sets and past performances. 

Perception of the office: It seemed to me that the people who worked there were rather cold and professional, and one woman indicated that I would be everyone's servant (without actually saying that, but she impressed that idea quite firmly) and that I would have to deal with people who were in bad moods often (again, not her exact words, but the general idea). I came away from the interview not wanting the position. I do not know who they hired for the job, but the last person who held the job had a master's and was working on a Phd...so obviously extremely overqualified for a job that requires a minimum h.s. diploma. 
The salary seems fair with the market, $30,000 for an admin. assistant job.
Interview Questions: Questions were generally easy, and no behavioral based interview questions (example "Tell me about a time when you...), which was fortunate because I'm pretty sure everyone hates those questions.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: Job advertised with Science Careers.  Applied Online and was contacted within 3 weeks of application by email.  Had 3 telephone interviews, then was invited down to give a presentation with intense question and answer period.  Had six 1-on-1 interviews after presentation, followed by a one hour panel interview.  Had  one more conference call telephone interview upon returning home then received offer 2 days later.  Getting the details worked out from that point was difficult as the administrative procedures were arcane and administrators' help was poor.
Interview Questions: Why choose Penn?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: Was notified about the position through contacts, but it was also advertised widely.  Applied and in less than 3 weeks had one on-site interview.  Was offered the position soon thereafter.
Interview Questions: All were expected/straightforward

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: First interview 1:1, second interview 2:1, and third interview 4:1. Each of the interviews occurred a month or two apart and questions ranged from background/experience to professional goals/trajectory. Interviewers gave impression of a friendly, vision-oriented department in all 3 interviews. Office space arranged in cubicles; a little more cramped than perhaps in other areas of campus. Highly decentralized structure, with each individual mostly siloed off for his/her specific responsibilities.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Was a fairly easy interview, some basic questions about my line of work were asked as well as a small written test. I had to do an online computer skills based test as well as a personality question based text. Overall the tests were fairly easy and I got the job.
Interview Questions: It would be unfair of me to say.

title: International Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Interview in person twice within 2 weeks. The first interview was with the Assistant Dean of International Programs (with whom I would be working) and about 15 minutes at the end with the Dean of Internatinoal Admissions.  The second interview was also with her, plus about 15 minutes with the Dean of Administration.  It was pretty repetitive. The meeting with the Dean of Administration was ridiculously intense, so unnecessary. Its an admin assistant job, I have a bachelors degree from a top liberal arts college and I have been working in a similar position at UPenn for several months.  It doesn't take a genius to do admin assistant work. 

They ended up hiring someone extremely overqualified for the job.  UPenn has a habit of doin that. They will hire people with masters for jobs more suitable for recent college grads... and likewise they will hire recent grads for positions more suitable for 9th graders.  Oh, and you will be underpaid.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when.... I hate those questions.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Emailed professor, went to his office for a 30 minute interview. Professor showed me his lab and group. Described his research and challenges to be faced in the lab. Lab was organized but lacking in certain resources. Nice people to work around. Research proposal was not the most interesting.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: they asked me about my past experiences, student activities, "why you want to attend UPenn" question, and my favorite people in the history, who is your hero. They were particularly interested in my achievement in music, like why did you choose to play piano, how it helped your throughout your career.
Interview Questions: what's the achievement you were most proud of

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions:
After submitting application online I heard a response via phone message within 2 weeks requesting an interview. Met with a panel of managers who would share supervisor duties for the position. Questions focused on my personal goals and how I handle stress in the workplace. I had done research of the department online and was able to format my answers to apply to the position/department. All of the four managers facilitating the interview asked questions and participated; rapport was congenial. I made a point to make eye contact with all questioners when answering questions. After this group interview I was introduced to another administrative assistant and given an opportunity to discuss the position and the work environment. 

I sent thank you letters to all of the managers I met with as well as the admin assistant. I followed up via e-mail after a week with no response. A week later I received a phone message thanking me for the interview and informing me they went with another candidate who had more experience I was encouraged to continue applying to U Penn. . I had a mistake on my resume that was pointed out during the initial interview; I have a feeling that was the one thing that cost me this position more than anything else. I sent another thank you letter asking for any advice as I continue my job search but received no further response.
Interview Questions: How would you handle multiple projects and deadlines from different supervisors?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: This was like most postdoctoral fellowship interviews and pretty standard.  You meet with the PI (usually after being introduced by a colleague at your institution), have an informal interview with them regarding your research, discuss potential projects and funding, and finally give a postdoctoral seminar talk.  After that, you may meet with other PIs in the department.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about your research?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pennsylvania (Phila, PA) in Aug 2007
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Principal investigator and sat in her office for about 2 hours. It was a casual conversation about my background and my college experience. It was also very informal. I think the most important aspect was whether or not I clicked with the Principal invetsigator
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself
